title: Norfolk Island
summary: Norfolk Island (/ˈnɔːrfək/, locally /ˈnɔːrfoʊk/;[8] Norfuk: Norf'k Ailen[9]) is an  external territory of Australia located in the Pacific Ocean between New Zealand and New Caledonia, 1,412 kilometres (877 mi) directly east of Australia's Evans Head and about 900 kilometres (560 mi) from Lord Howe Island. Together with the neighbouring Phillip Island and Nepean Island, the three islands collectively form the Territory of Norfolk Island.[10] At the 2016 census, it had 1748 inhabitants living on a total area of about 35 km2 (14 sq mi).[6] Its capital is Kingston.
